body_html:
Ok, problem solved by including

#include <torch/tensor.h>

and using torch::Tensor instead of at::Tensor.

The C++ extensions tutorial uses at::Tensor and now I'm confused: should we always use torch::Tensor, when should we use at::Tensor? Is the tutorial wrong? :-)

You can close this issue, but I think the distinction between the two should be clarified somewhere, or if it already is, can you point me to it?

Thank you!
body_text:
Ok, problem solved by including
#include <torch/tensor.h>
and using torch::Tensor instead of at::Tensor.
The C++ extensions tutorial uses at::Tensor and now I'm confused: should we always use torch::Tensor, when should we use at::Tensor? Is the tutorial wrong? :-)
You can close this issue, but I think the distinction between the two should be clarified somewhere, or if it already is, can you point me to it?
Thank you!
body:
Ok, problem solved by including

`#include <torch/tensor.h>`

and using `torch::Tensor` instead of `at::Tensor`.

The [C++ extensions tutorial](https://pytorch.org/tutorials/advanced/cpp_extension.html) uses `at::Tensor` and now I'm confused: should we always use `torch::Tensor`, when should we use `at::Tensor`? Is the tutorial wrong? :-)

You can close this issue, but I think the distinction between the two should be clarified somewhere, or if it already is, can you point me to it?

Thank you!
